title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ArgentinAPI package provides comprehensive unified interface access open data Argentina multiple public RESTful APIs, including ArgentinaDatos API, REST Countries API, World Bank API. sources, users can easily retrieve information exchange rates, inflation, political figures, national holidays, economic indicators, general country-level statistics. addition API-access functions, package includes collection curated datasets covering diverse domains economic indicators, biodiversity, agriculture, human rights, genetic data, consumer prices. integrating open APIs high-quality datasets multiple domains, ArgentinAPI supports research, teaching, analysis focused Argentina, making versatile tool academics, professionals, policymakers.

title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ArgentinAPI package provides several core functions access real-time structured information Argentina public APIs ArgentinaDatos, REST Countries, World Bank API. list main functions included package: get_argentina_holidays() – Retrieves public holidays Argentina specific year using ArgentinaDatos API. get_argentine_senators() - Returns current list Argentine senators ArgentinaDatos API. get_argentine_deputies() – Returns current list Argentine deputies ArgentinaDatos API. get_country_info_ar() – Retrieves general country-level information Argentina REST Countries API get_dollar_exchange_rates() – Retrieves recent exchange rates different dollar markets (official, blue, MEP, CCL) ArgentinaDatos API. get_presidential_events() – Retrieves list official presidential events ArgentinaDatos API. get_argentina_child_mortality(): Get Argentina’s -5 Mortality Rate data World Bank. get_argentina_energy_use(): Get Argentina’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) data World Bank. get_argentina_gdp(): Get Argentina’s GDP (current US$) data World Bank. get_argentina_hospital_beds(): Get Argentina’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) data World Bank. get_argentina_life_expectancy(): Get Argentina’s Life Expectancy Birth data World Bank. get_argentina_population(): Get Argentina’s Total Population data World Bank. get_argentina_unemployment(): Get Argentina’s Total Unemployment Rate data World Bank. view_datasets_ArgentinAPI() – Lists curated datasets included ArgentinAPI package across various thematic areas economy, biodiversity, genetics, agriculture, . functions allow users access high-quality structured information Argentina, can combined tools like dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2 support wide range data analysis visualization tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work ArgentinAPI practical scenarios.

title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Display the first 10 Argentine senators  argentine_senators <- head(get_argentine_senators(),n=10)  print(argentine_senators) #> # A tibble: 10 × 6 #>    id    nombre                        provincia  partido  inicio     fin        #>    <chr> <chr>                         <chr>      <chr>    <date>     <date>     #>  1 577   Cora, Stefania                Entre Ríos Frente … 2025-02-20 2025-12-09 #>  2 294   Mayans, José Miguel Ángel     Formosa    Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  3 551   Paoltroni, Francisco Manuel   Formosa    Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  4 555   López, María Florencia        La Rioja   Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  5 557   Pagotto, Juan Carlos          La Rioja   Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  6 558   Arce, Carlos Omar             Misiones   Frente … 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  7 559   Rojas Decut, Sonia Elizabeth  Misiones   Frente … 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  8 560   Goerling Lara, Enrique Martin Misiones   Juntos … 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #>  9 561   Uñac, Sergio Mauricio         San Juan   Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09 #> 10 563   Olivera Lucero, Bruno Antonio San Juan   Alianza… 2023-12-10 2029-12-09

what: Argentina’s GDP (Current US$) from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: argentina_gdp <- head(get_argentina_gdp())  print(argentina_gdp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country    year         value value_label     #>   <chr>             <chr>     <int>         <dbl> <chr>           #> 1 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2022 632790070063. 632,790,070,063 #> 2 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2021 486564085480. 486,564,085,480 #> 3 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2020 385740508437. 385,740,508,437 #> 4 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2019 447754683615. 447,754,683,615 #> 5 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2018 524819892360. 524,819,892,360 #> 6 GDP (current US$) Argentina  2017 643628393281. 643,628,393,281

what: Argentina’s Life Expectancy at Birth from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: argentina_life_expectancy <- head(get_argentina_life_expectancy())  print(argentina_life_expectancy) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   indicator                               country    year value #>   <chr>                                   <chr>     <int> <dbl> #> 1 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2022  75.8 #> 2 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2021  73.9 #> 3 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2020  75.9 #> 4 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2019  76.8 #> 5 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2018  76.8 #> 6 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Argentina  2017  76.5

what: Corn Yield Response to Nitrogen Levels
title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Summary: average corn yield by nitrogen level corn_summary <- corn_nitrogen_df %>%   group_by(nitro) %>%   summarise(     mean_yield = mean(yield, na.rm = TRUE),     .groups = "drop"   )  # Plot: nitrogen vs. average corn yield ggplot(corn_summary, aes(x = nitro, y = mean_yield)) +   geom_line(color = "#1f77b4", size = 1) +   geom_point(size = 2, color = "#1f77b4") +   labs(     title = "Corn Yield by Nitrogen Level",     x = "Nitrogen Level (kg/ha)",     y = "Average Yield (quintals/ha)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset ArgentinAPI labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame. _tbl_df: tibble (modern data frame). _ts: time series object. _matrix: matrix structure. _list: list object.

title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, ArgentinAPI provides several preloaded datasets offering insights Argentina’s economic, agricultural, demographic, genetic indicators. featured examples: corn_nitrogen_df: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data data frame yield monitor data corn field Argentina, including variables nitrogen application, yield, topography, block replicates. STRs_argentina_list: STRs Allelic Frequencies Argentina list allelic frequencies 24 Short Tandem Repeat (STR) genetic markers collected different populations across Argentina.

title: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentinian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: ArgentinAPI package brings together public RESTful APIs—including ArgentinaDatos, REST Countries, World Bank API—collection curated datasets covering domains economic indicators, biodiversity, agriculture, human rights, genetic data, consumer prices. integrating diverse sources, package enables comprehensive, reproducible, high-quality research analysis focused Argentina. Whether goal study macroeconomic trends, evaluate environmental agricultural data, explore social genetic indicators, ArgentinAPI provides versatile reliable toolkit researchers, educators, policymakers, data enthusiasts.

STRs_argentina_list: STRs Allelic Frequencies Argentina list allelic frequencies 24 Short Tandem Repeat (STR) genetic markers collected different populations across Argentina.

what: ArgentinAPI: Access Argentine Economic, Social, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets — ArgentinAPI

title: Consumer Price Index in Argentina (1970–1990) — Argentina_CPI_ts
text: dataset, `Argentina_CPI_ts`, quarterly time series Consumer Price Index (CPI) Argentina 1970 1990. CPI reflects changes general price level goods services purchased households time.

title: Consumer Price Index in Argentina (1970–1990) — Argentina_CPI_ts
Consumer Price Index in Argentina (1970–1990) — Argentina_CPI_ts
text: quarterly time series (`ts`) object 1970 1990 80 observations: Time span 1970 Q1 1990 Q4 Values Quarterly CPI values (numeric)

title: Consumer Price Index in Argentina (1970–1990) — Argentina_CPI_ts

title: Consumer Price Index in Argentina (1970–1990) — Argentina_CPI_ts
text: dataset name kept 'Argentina_CPI_ts' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part ArgentinAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'ts' indicates dataset time series object class `ts`. original content modified way.

what: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
title: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
text: dataset, corn_nitrogen_df, data frame containing yield monitor data corn field Argentina. includes information yield response varying nitrogen application levels, along spatial coordinates, topographic classification, block structure experimental design.

title: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
text: data frame 3443 observations 9 variables: year Integer indicating year observation lat Numeric vector latitude coordinates long Numeric vector longitude coordinates yield Numeric vector representing corn yield nitro Numeric vector representing nitrogen application level topo Factor 4 levels indicating topographic classification bv Numeric vector representing block variance rep Factor 3 levels indicating replication blocks nf Factor 6 levels indicating nitrogen field treatments

title: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
text: Data taken agridat package version 1.24

title: Argentina Corn Yield & Nitrogen Data — corn_nitrogen_df
text: dataset name kept 'corn_nitrogen_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part ArgentinAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.

what: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
text: Retrieves Argentina's -5 mortality rate, measured number deaths children five years age per 1,000 live births, years 2010 2022 using World Bank Open Data API. indicator used SH.DYN.MORT.

title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
text: World Bank Open Data API: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.DYN.MORT

title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
text: tibble following columns: indicator: Indicator name (e.g., "Mortality rate, -5 (per 1,000 live births)") country: Country name ("Argentina") year: Year data (integer) value: Mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)

title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
text: function sends GET request World Bank API. API request fails returns error status code, function returns NULL informative message.

title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality
text: Requires internet connection.

title: Get Argentina's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_argentina_child_mortality

Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
text: function retrieves list Argentine deputies public API endpoint `https://api.argentinadatos.com/v1/diputados/diputados`. includes basic information official mandate period deputy.

title: Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
text: tibble following columns: id: Unique identifier deputy. nombre: First name deputy. apellido: Last name deputy. genero: Gender deputy. provincia: Province represented. inicio: Start date mandate period (Date). fin: End date mandate period (Date).

title: Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
text: data returned descending order start date (inicio), showing recent mandates first.

title: Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
text: Requires internet connection. `inicio` `fin` dates malformed, parsing may fail.

title: Get Argentine Deputies (Diputados) — get_argentine_deputies
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ deputies <- get_argentine_deputies() head(deputies)  # Filter currently active deputies active <- dplyr::filter(deputies, Sys.Date() <= fin) } # }

what: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
title: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
text: function retrieves list senators Argentine Senate API endpoint: `https://api.argentinadatos.com/v1/senado/senadores`. result includes name, province, party affiliation, legal term office. results sorted start legal term descending order (recent first).

title: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
text: data frame (tibble) following columns: id: Unique identifier senator. nombre: Full name senator. provincia: Province represented. partido: Political party. inicio: Start date legal period (Date). fin: End date legal period (Date).

title: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
text: function parses nested JSON structure returned API, extracts period data, ensures `inicio` `fin` treated proper `Date` objects. data sorted `inicio` descending order prioritize currently active recently active senators.

title: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
text: Requires internet access. cautious malformed missing date fields.

title: Get Current and Past Senators of Argentina — get_argentine_senators
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ senators <- get_argentine_senators() head(senators)  # Filter only currently active senators active <- dplyr::filter(senators, Sys.Date() <= fin) } # }

what: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
text: function retrieves list official holidays Argentina specified year. data obtained public API https://api.argentinadatos.com/v1/feriados/. can append desired year end URL. example: https://api.argentinadatos.com/v1/feriados/2024/ year provided, function returns holidays current year.

title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
text: year integer representing year (2016 2025). Defaults current year.

title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
text: data frame following columns: fecha: Date holiday (character YYYY-MM-DD format). tipo: Type holiday (e.g., "inamovible", "trasladable"). nombre: Name reason holiday.

title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
text: function sends GET request ArgentinaDatos API converts JSON response structured data frame. validates input year falls back current year none specified. API return 200 status code, function return NULL emit message.

title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
text: Requires active internet connection. API unavailable structure changes, function may need updates.

title: Get Official Holidays in Argentina for a Given Year — get_argentinian_holidays
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get holidays for the year 2025 feriados_2025 <- get_argentinian_holidays(2025) print(feriados_2025)  # Get holidays for the current year feriados_actual <- get_argentinian_holidays() View(feriados_actual) } # }

what: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: Retrieves selected, essential information Argentina country full name. data retrieved REST Countries API. See API documentation https://restcountries.com/. Example API usage: https://restcountries.com/v3.1/name/argentina?fullText=true.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: name Full country name (common official). example: "Argentina", "Peru", "France".

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: data frame 8 columns: name_common: Common name country. name_official: Official name country. capital: Capital city. region: Geographic region. subregion: Subregion. population: Total population. area: Total area square kilometers. languages: Official languages, separated commas.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: function returns readable details country's common official name, capital, region, subregion, population, area, official languages. function sends GET request REST Countries API. request successful (HTTP 200), parses JSON extracts key fields. country found error, function returns NULL user-friendly message.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info

what: Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
title: Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
text: Retrieves comprehensive country information Argentina REST Countries API. function fetches data including official common names, geographical information, capital, area, population, languages.

title: Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
text: tibble one row containing Argentina's country information: name_common Common name country name_official Official name country region Geographic region subregion Geographic subregion capital Capital city(ies) area Total area square kilometers population Total population languages Languages spoken (comma-separated)

title: Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
text: function makes request REST Countries API v3.1 endpoint specifically Argentina using full text search. handles API errors gracefully returns NULL request fails data found.

title: Get Country Information for Argentina — get_country_info_ar
code: # \donttest{ # Get Argentina information ar_info <- get_country_info_ar() print(ar_info) #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   name_common name_official region subregion capital   area population languages #>   <chr>       <chr>         <chr>  <chr>     <chr>    <dbl>      <int> <chr>     #> 1 Argentina   Argentine Re… Ameri… South Am… Buenos… 2.78e6   45376763 Guaraní,… # }

Get Presidential Events in Argentina — get_presidential_events

what: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
title: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
text: function retrieves latest exchange rates US dollar (USD) multiple currency exchange houses Argentina, using public API `https://api.argentinadatos.com/v1/cotizaciones/dolares`. results sorted descending order date (recent first).

title: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
text: data frame (tibble) following columns: casa: Name exchange house (e.g., Blue, Oficial, Mayorista). compra: Buying rate (numeric). venta: Selling rate (numeric). fecha: Date rate (Date format).

title: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
text: function connects ArgentinaDatos API obtain current USD exchange rates. arranges results descending order date, making recent data easier access.

title: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
text: Requires internet connection. Results may vary depending API availability.

title: Get USD Exchange Rates from Argentina's Currency Markets — get_usd_exchange_rates
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get latest USD exchange rates rates <- get_usd_exchange_rates() head(rates)  # Shows the most recent ones first  # Filter for the year 2025 rates_2025 <- dplyr::filter(rates, lubridate::year(fecha) == 2025) } # }

title: Pollination Web from Argentina — pollination_matrix

title: Pollination Web from Argentina — pollination_matrix

title: ArgentinAPI 0.2.0
text: get_country_info() renamed get_country_info_ar() avoid naming conflicts packages improve function identification. following API added ArgentinAPI package: World Bank API https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/889392. following functions added ArgentinAPI package: get_argentina_child_mortality(): Get Argentina’s -5 Mortality Rate data World Bank. get_argentina_energy_use(): Get Argentina’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) data World Bank. get_argentina_gdp(): Get Argentina’s GDP (current US$) data World Bank. get_argentina_hospital_beds(): Get Argentina’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) data World Bank. get_argentina_life_expectancy(): Get Argentina’s Life Expectancy Birth data World Bank. get_argentina_population(): Get Argentina’s Total Population data World Bank. get_argentina_unemployment(): Get Argentina’s Total Unemployment Rate data World Bank.

title: ArgentinAPI 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-08

title: ArgentinAPI 0.1.0
text: First release ArgentinAPI package. Added view_datasets_ArgentinAPI() function explore available datasets. Curated Collection datasets cover diverse aspects Chilean society. Initial APIs ArgentinaDatos API REST Countries API – Added functions powered APIs
